results.title: The Efficacy of Rosuvastatin, Amlodipine, and Aspirin in the Treatment of Hypertension with Coronary Heart Disease and Its Effect on Platelet Aggregation
results.text_hl: This suggests that @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@ are more effective than @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ alone in lowering plasma viscosity and @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet aggregation@@@.

citations.NLM: Fu J, Wang T, Li B, Zhao N. The Efficacy of Rosuvastatin, Amlodipine, and Aspirin in the Treatment of Hypertension with Coronary Heart Disease and Its Effect on Platelet Aggregation Dis Markers. 2022;2022():1111438. PMID: 36284992

results.title: Verapamil is a potent inhibitor of 5-HT-induced platelet aggregation.
results.text_hl: We have studied the effects of @CHEMICAL_Verapamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014700 @@@verapamil@@@, @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ on @CHEMICAL_Serotonin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012701 @@@5-HT@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet aggregation@@@ and compared the results with those obtained for other @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet aggregating@@@ agents.

citations.NLM: Glusa E, Bevan J, Heptinstall S. Verapamil is a potent inhibitor of 5-HT-induced platelet aggregation. Thromb Res. 1989 Jul 15;55(2):239-245. PMID: 2528843

results.title: Association of the use of amlodipine with clopidogrel response in Chinese patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention.
results.text_hl: Moreover, in a linear regression model, the use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ was independently associated with @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@MPA@@@ values (R = 0.375, P < 0.001), suggesting that the use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ might link to the increased @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@MPA@@@.

citations.NLM: Liu XQ, Lin S, Qiu LL, Lin L, Zhao YY, Xu HM, Zhang J, Zou JJ. Association of the use of amlodipine with clopidogrel response in Chinese patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention. Pharmazie. 2014 Nov;69(11):814-7. PMID: 25985576

results.title: Effects of amlodipine and enalapril on platelet function in patients with mild to moderate hypertension.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@Platelet aggregation@@@ was reduced by @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ in 15.9% for @CHEMICAL_Adenosine_Diphosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000244 @@@ADP@@@ (10 microM); 17.4% for collagen (2 microg/ml) and 19.9% for @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@adrenaline@@@ (2 microM) (p < 0.025).

citations.NLM: Hernández-Hernández R, Armas-Padilla MC, Velasco M, Carvajal AR, Armas de Hernández MJ, Guerrero-Pajuelo J, Pacheco B. Effects of amlodipine and enalapril on platelet function in patients with mild to moderate hypertension. Int J Clin Pharmacol Ther. 1999 Jul;37(7):323-31. PMID: 10442506
